hanzi-su-wiki:
飢

Значения

Голодать

Мнемоника

Столики 几 с едой 食. При богатом урожае излишки зерна изымались, а во время голода император открывал амбары и кормил население бесплатно.

Варианты

饑, 饥

jī
hungry
голодный
rtega_mnemonic:
飢飢RShunger, starving, hungry, famine
  • hungry people come to the table 几 to eat 飠
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 饥)
Antonyms: 飽
Pictophonetic: 几 indicates the sound; 飠 (food) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
飢餓 [ jī è ]: hunger; starvation; famine
饑荒 [ jī huāng ]: crop failure; famine; debt; difficulty
飢渴 [ jī kě ]: hungry and thirsty; (fig.) to crave (knowledge, love etc)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 飠 [ shí ] food; to eat
    • 几 [ jǐ ] small table; how many; a few, some
heisig_chinese_memo: The smell of cooked food wafts past you in the wind, making your stomach rumble and reminding you that you're starving.
heisig_constituent: hungry, eat, food, umbrella, good, halo, drop, silver, wind
koohiiStory1: The smell of cooked food wafts past you in the wind, making your stomach rumble and feeling hungry.
koohiiStory2: The wind blew away my food, so now I´m hungry.
jp_example_words:
飢える(うえる): starve
飢饉(ききん): famine
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You’re so hungry that you eat a table so you won’t starve. If you don’t eat this table, you will most definitely starve, so you eat the table to stay alive.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You don’t want to starve, do you? Feel your tummy gurgle in pain. You gotta eat this table. Taste the dry wood taste on your tongue as you eat the table and get splinters in your tongue and gums.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: After you finish the table, you still feel like you might starve so you decide to eat every key (き) off your key ring. One by one, you eat each and every key so you don’t starve.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine eating every key. Taste the cold metal on your tongue. After you swallow each key, you hear it clink against the other keys already in your tummy. Clink!
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you eat (飠) at the table (几) if you're starving
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: I have only a small table at home because I live alone, but when I'm starving it's covered with food.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " food ", " ji ", the original meaning is hungry, not enough to eat. "Shuowen": "Hungry. From food, a few beeps." "Shu-Shun Dian": "Li people prevent hunger, you Huji sow hundreds of grains."

" Hunger " also means to make people hungry. "Mencius·Li Louxia": "Ji thinks about those who are hungry in the world.

" Hunger " is also commonly referred to as " starvation ", which means a famine, a very poor age or no harvest. Qing Zhu Junsheng "Shuowen Tongxun Dingsheng‧ Lübu": "Hunger, 叚borrowed as hunger." "Mozi‧ Wufu": "Five grains do not accept hunger."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " food ", " ji ", the original meaning is hungry, not enough to eat.
humanum_full_description:
從「食」，「几」聲，本義為餓、吃不飽。《說文》：「餓也。从食，几聲。」《書‧舜典》：「黎民阻飢，汝后稷播時百穀。」

　　「飢」也表示使人受餓。《孟子‧離婁下》：「稷思天下有飢者，由己飢之也。」

　　「飢」亦通作「饑」，表示災荒，年成很差或顆粒無收。清朱駿聲《說文通訓定聲‧履部》：「飢，叚借為饑。」《墨子‧五輔》：「五穀不收謂之飢。」
humanum_short_description: 從「食」，「几」聲，本義為餓、吃不飽。

飢飢RS hunger, starving, hungry, famine
  • hungry people come to the table 几 to eat 飠
(Simplified: 饥)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 飽
Pictophonetic: 几 indicates the sound; 飠 (food) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 飠 [ shí ] food; to eat
    • 几 [ jǐ ] small table; how many; a few, some
①用本義。荒年，五穀無收。［例］五穀不熟謂之飢。——《墨子·七患》。［例］降喪饑饉。——《詩·小雅·雨無止》。［例］齊嘗大飢，道旁餓死者不可數也。——《韓非子·外儲說右上》。［例］凶年飢發，君之民老弱轉乎溝壑。——《孟子·梁惠王下》。［例］四時不出，天下大飢。——《淮南子·天文》。［例］今山東饑饉，人庶相食。——《漢書·翼奉傳》。［合］饑荒；飢餒(飢餓)；飢時得一口(緊要處得人救濟，恩德深厚)；飢氓(逃荒的人)；飢歲(荒年)。
②(動）∶通“飢”。喫不飽，餓。［例］黎民不飢不寒。——《孟子·梁惠王上》。［例］寧一月飢，無一旬餓。——《淮南子·說山訓》。［例］牛困人飢日已高。——唐·白居易《賣炭翁》。［例］飢渴而頓踣。——唐·柳宗元《捕蛇者說》。［例］風雨霜露飢寒顛踣。——清·洪亮吉《治平篇》。
③姓氏。

從「 食 」，「 几 」聲，本義為餓、吃不飽。《說文》：「餓也。从食，几聲。」《書‧舜典》：「黎民阻飢，汝后稷播時百穀。」 「 飢 」也表示使人受餓。《孟子‧離婁下》：「稷思天下有飢者，由己飢之也。」 「 飢 」亦通作「 饑 」，表示災荒，年成很差或顆粒無收。清朱駿聲《說文通訓定聲‧履部》：「飢，叚借為饑。」《墨子‧五輔》：「五穀不收謂之飢。」
From the sound of " food", " ji", the original meaning is hungry, not enough to eat. "Shuowen": "Hungry. From food, a few beeps." "Shu-Shun Dian": "Li people prevent hunger, you Huji sow hundreds of grains." " Hunger" also means to make people hungry. "Mencius·Li Louxia": "Ji thinks about those who are hungry in the world. " Hunger" is also commonly referred to as " starvation", which means a famine, a very poor age or no harvest. Qing Zhu Junsheng "Shuowen Tongxun Dingsheng‧ Lübu": "Hunger, 叚borrowed as hunger." "Mozi‧ Wufu": "Five grains do not accept hunger."

飢字的基本解释

飢
jī
见“饥”。

飢字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jī］
［《廣韻》居夷切，平脂，見。］
(1)吃不饱；饿。
(2)使人受饿。
(3)通“饑”。年成很差或颗粒无收。
(4)古国名。
(5)姓。见《广韵·平脂》“飢”下引《左传》。今本《左传·定公四年》作“饑”。

飢字的康熙字典解释

【戌集下】【食字部】　飢； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页1416第08
【唐韻】【集韻】居夷切【韻會】居狋切，?音肌。【玉篇】餓也。【書·舜典】黎民阻飢。【爾雅·釋天】穀不熟爲飢。【註】五穀不成。【又】仍飢爲荐。【註】連歲不熟。【韓詩外傳】一穀不升曰歉，二穀不升曰飢。　又【正字通】國名。西伯伐飢國，滅之。　又姓。【左傳·定四年】殷民七族，有飢氏。又漢有大豪飢恬。○按《說文》飢、饑二字，飢訓餓，居夷切，饑訓穀不熟，居衣切。汪來虞方伯說，饑饉之饑从幾，飢渴之飢从几，諸韻書俱分列支微兩韻，止《集韻》飢字訓或从幾，經傳頗通用。《長箋》云：近代喜茂密者通作饑，趨?便者通作飢，遂成兩謬。經傳不誤，恐傳寫之譌也。　【集韻】別作?。

【龍龕】同?。
考證：〔【左傳·定二年】殷人七族，有飢氏。〕　謹照原文二年改四年。殷人改殷民。

["Guangyun" is cut at home, flat fat, see. ]
(1) Not enough to eat; hungry.

(4) Ancient country name.
(5) Last name. See "Zuo Zhuan" under "Hunger" in "Guangyun·Pingzhi". Today's "Zuo Zhuan·Ding Gong Four Years" is written as "Hunger".

Name meaning

jī
вм. 饥
Radicals: 食, 几  (eat, table)
Meaning Mnemonic
You’re so hungry that you eat a table so you won’t starve. If you don’t eat this table, you will most definitely starve, so you eat the table to stay alive.
You don’t want to starve, do you? Feel your tummy gurgle in pain. You gotta eat this table. Taste the dry wood taste on your tongue as you eat the table and get splinters in your tongue and gums.
Reading Mnemonic
After you finish the table, you still feel like you might starve so you decide to eat every key (き) off your key ring. One by one, you eat each and every key so you don’t starve.
Imagine eating every key. Taste the cold metal on your tongue. After you swallow each key, you hear it clink against the other keys already in your tummy. Clink!
